* Subclass of Command. Handles adding of equipment to equipmentInventory.
public static final String COMMAND_DESCRIPTION = ": Adds a Equipment to the equipmentInventory. "
+ "Parameters: n/ITEM_NAME sn/SERIAL_NUMBER t/TYPE c/COST pf/PURCHASED_FROM pd/PURCHASED_DATE\n"
+ "add n/SpeakerB sn/S1404115ASF t/Speaker c/1000 pf/Loud_Technologies pd/2022-02-23";
* constructor for AddCommand. Initialises successMessage and usageReminder from Command
* @param commandStrings parsed user input which contains details of equipment to be added
* Adds equipment with details given in COMMAND_STRINGS
* @return CommandResult with message from execution of this command
* Uses information from the ArrayList to create a new Equipment and add it to the inventory.
* @param userInput ArrayList of String which contains the individual attributes of the equipment to be added
Equipment equipment = new Equipment(equipmentName, serialNumber, type, cost, purchasedFrom, purchasedDate);
* Subclass of Command. Handles checking of details of a specified equipment from equipmentInventory.
public static final String COMMAND_DESCRIPTION = ": Gives details of the equipment with the specified name. "
* constructor for CheckCommand. Initialises successMessage and usageReminder from Command
* @param commandStrings parsed user input which contains details of equipment to be viewed
* Gives details of equipment specified by name
* @return CommandResult with message from execution of this command
String name, type, sn, purchasedFrom, purchasedDate;
return new CommandResult(String.format(successMessage, name, type, cost, sn, purchasedFrom, purchasedDate));

* Prepare arguments for AddCommand by splitting up the arguments into different parts
* 1. serialNumber : String of unique serial number
* 2. type : String representation of enumerated class
* 3. cost : String representation of double value, "$" optional but "," delimiter forbidden
* 4. purchasedFrom : String of vendor name, suggest adhering to one consistent naming scheme
* 5. purchasedDate : String representation for now, possibility for future support

* Break down a command into the command term to be parsed and the remainder of the arguments.
* Assumes command term and remainder arguments are delimited by minimally one space.
* @return ArrayList of String, first element being the command term and the second element being arguments
* @throws IncompleteCommandException if no space is found
